data.job_description:
Are you passionate about shaping the future of education? Do you thrive on creativity and innovation? EDUopinions, a global hub for verified university reviews, invites you to join our dynamic team as a Social Media Marketing Intern. In this rapidly expanding environment, we're seeking individuals unafraid to break barriers and make a real impact on the educational landscape.

Tasks

Responsibilities:
• Content Creation: Develop engaging TikTok and Instagram content, including posts, reels, and videos.
• Strategy Implementation: Execute social media marketing strategies to enhance brand visibility and engagement.
• Analytics & Optimization: Monitor social media metrics, analyze performance, and provide insights for continuous improvement.
• Community Building: Interact with followers, respond to comments, and foster a community around the brand.
• Trend Awareness: Stay updated on social media trends, algorithms, and emerging platforms to keep content innovative.
• Voice Fresh Perspectives: Your role as an intern is not just about tasks; it's about contributing fresh perspectives. Share your feedback on existing processes and suggest innovative ideas to enhance our operational efficiency.

Requirements

Qualifications:
• Enrolled in or completed a bachelor's degree in marketing, business administration, communications, or a related field.
• Basic understanding of marketing principles, including market research, social media, and email marketing.
• Excellent communication, writing, and analytical skills.
• Strong time management skills, crucial for handling responsibilities within deadlines.
• A creative and innovative mindset, coupled with a keen eagerness to learn.

Duration:

This is a remote, part-time internship for ten weeks, beginning in mid-February 2024. (Dates are flexible)

Compensation:

Beyond invaluable work experience, our Interns receive a stipend, professional development opportunities, and access to a supportive and inclusive work environment.

To Apply:
• Write Your Review: Visit EDUopinions, find your university, and share your review. It's not just a step; it's a crucial part of understanding our concept and review process.
• Email Us: Send a screenshot of the 'thank you' page post-review submission and a brief letter of motivation to .

Role and Facility Information

Chilliwack General Hospital is seeking two General Internists to join our team.The successful candidate will have a solid background in all aspects of General Internal Medicine, with an emphasis on acute care cardiology and critical care. The general internists share access to exercise treadmill testing, ECG and Holter interpretation, and participate in the in-hospital GIM rapid access clinic and graduated care clinic. Team based health care is emphasized with Inter-disciplinary rounds in both the ICU and general wards required while on inpatient services. Participation in a city of Hope outreach program is also expected.

Chilliwack General Hospital is a busy community hospital. We have 4 General Surgeons, 4 Orthopedic Surgeons, 2 Urologists, 3 Obs/Gyne, a low risk obstetrics ward, and a psychiatric ward. Radiology provides in-hospital echocardiogram, CT, ultrasound, and some interventional procedures. There is a full PFT lab on site. Endoscopy, ERCP and bronchoscopy are provided in the Ambulatory care setting.

There is a highly respected Family Practice residency program in Chilliwack. Residents have a strong clinical rural/community focus, and participate in Internal Medicine rotations. CGH is also one of the sites for the Integrated Clerkship program for 3rd year medical students.

Our goal is to foster excellence in clinical practice in a collegial atmosphere, with attention to work-life balance and personal and professional development. We strive to provide community-focused care.

Facility: Chilliwack General Hospital

Chilliwack General Hospital is a 131 bed, University of BC affiliated community hospital offering medical, surgical, obstetrics, psychiatry, and a regional eye centre, as well as 24/7 emergency services with 60,585 visits annually.

Simplot Canada (II) Limited is a wholly owned subsidiary of the J.R. Simplot Company. The J.R. Simplot Company is a diverse, privately held organization, with roots firmly planted in agriculture and agriculture-related businesses. The J.R. Simplot Company is a true farm-to-table company with operations that touch every aspect of agriculture, including seed production, farming and ranching, plant sciences, fertilizer manufacturing, food processing, commercial product development, and distribution.

Summary

The Operations Intern program for the Simplot Food Group Manufacturing organization is an integrated opportunity, giving you a broad understanding on the manufacturing process. You will learn about multiple processes involved to produce quality potato or vegetable products. This could include quality assurance, maintenance, sanitation, production, continuous improvement. The position is a full time, summer-long internship approximately going from May to August.

Key Responsibilities
• Assists in data analysis of projects
• Assists as needed on the production floor to gather data and review/explain
• Complete specific job duties and projects while working with many different people and positions to gain understanding of various jobs in potato/vegetable processing.
• Get great exposure to the manufacturing process of producing potato and vegetable products.

Typical Education
• Pursuing a bachelor’s degree from 4-year college or university
• Strong academic record (suggested minimum 3.0 GPA), with a bachelor’s degree emphasis in Agriculture, Food Science, Business, Engineering

Job Requisition ID: 19780

Travel Required: None

Location(s): GF Plant - Portage la Prairie

Country: Canada

Now hiring! Summer Research Intern

Contract Duration: 4 months (Summer)

Lethbridge, AB

Wage: $22 - $30 / hour

We are looking for an Summer Research Intern to join our AP team in Lethbridge, AB.

Come create chemistry with us!

BASF’s Agricultural Solutions division connects innovation, customers, partners and agricultural experts and integrates sustainability criteria into all business decisions. We help farmers deliver the best possible outcomes, working to achieve the balance between economic, environmental and social value creation for sustainable and efficient agriculture.

As a Summer Research Intern, you create chemistry by...
• Supporting the research program and helping develop agricultural solutions for Canadian growers.
• Planning and executing small plot field experiments at our research farms (Seed, spray, evaluate, maintain, harvest, summarize and present results).
• Being involved in experiences in crop production, trial methodology, pest identification and the operation of small plot equipment.
• Working in and supporting a safe and healthy work environment.

If you have...
• Current enrollment in an agriculture or related degree program. (e.g. environmental science, biology, agronomy, soil science, etc.) or agriculture diploma program.
• High level of enthusiasm and strong commitment to gain experience in field research and the agricultural industry.
• Demonstrated leadership skills & academic achievement.
• An understanding of agricultural practices and farm equipment is an asset.
• Valid Driver‘s License.

About McElhanney

Based in Western Canada for over 110 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,400 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.

The Opportunity:

The McElhanney internship and new graduate experience allows you to explore your career path by providing hands-on experience in both the field and office. We connect you with industry-leading mentors and a cohort of top-tier students from across Canada. Our interns and graduates work with multidisciplinary engineering teams to apply their academic knowledge and assist with project delivery from design to construction. Whether it’s developing drawings or conducting site inspections, you’ll gain the skills and training needed to solve real-world problems.

Our team fosters a welcoming environment that encourages learning, growth, and building meaningful relationships. More importantly, we’ve cultivated a fun and inclusive culture, making McElhanney a workplace where our interns often choose to build long-term careers after graduation. Additionally, we’ve created programs to nurture the growth of future leaders. We’re proud of our reputation for developing talent and maintaining a positive, friendly, and rewarding work environment.

Join McElhanney, a firm with big company opportunities and a small company feel !

What You’ll Be Doing:
• Collaborate with Engineers and Project Managers to develop designs from conceptual to detailed stages, using AutoCAD and Civil 3D for multidisciplinary projects.
• Conduct field inspections for infrastructure construction and liaise with contractors on client sites.
• Work with the team to ensure schedules, budgets, quality control, and safety standards are met and maintained.
• Gain exposure to various McElhanney services, including materials testing, construction management, municipal infrastructure, transportation, water resources, geotechnical, bridge, and structural engineering.
• Participate in McElhanney’s industry-leading safety practices to exceed client needs while ensuring our teams Think Safe, Work Safe, and Get Home Safe.

What You’ll Focus On:

As part of your experience, you’ll choose a primary discipline from the following areas, allowing you to gain specialized knowledge and skills. Based on your interest, you will work on real-world projects, supported by a multidisciplinary team of experts.
• Alternate Project: Work on unique, non-conventional projects that challenge traditional civil engineering paths and solutions, such as Design-Build and Public-Private Partnerships (P3).
• Water Resources: Focus on managing water systems, including flood control, stormwater management, and irrigation design.
• Transportation/Strategic Transportation Planning: Specialize in the planning and design of transportation systems, with an emphasis on long-term, strategic planning initiatives.
• Traffic & Safety: Dive into traffic system design and safety analysis, contributing to safer and more efficient transportation networks.
• Structural & Bridge Engineering: Develop expertise in designing and analyzing structural components such as buildings and bridges.
• Planning: Explore urban and regional planning with a focus on sustainable development and land use.
• Municipal Engineering: Focus on the design and development of urban infrastructure, including roads, water distribution systems, and waste management.
• Land Development: Specialize in the planning and engineering of residential, commercial, and industrial land development projects.
• Landscape Architecture: Work on projects that merge functionality with aesthetics, designing outdoor spaces in urban and rural settings.
• Geotechnical/Materials Testing: Learn to assess and test soils and construction materials to ensure stability and safety in various designs.
• Environmental Engineering: Focus on environmental solutions that balance ecological protection with client needs, offering expertise in assessment, remediation, planning, and sustainable design.
• Construction Management: Specialize in managing construction projects from start to finish, ensuring quality, budget, and safety standards are met.

What You’ll Bring:
• Enrolled in a Diploma or Degree program in Civil Engineering.
• Familiarity with AutoCAD Civil 3D, Revit or related software is an asset.
• Previous work experience in Civil Engineering or Construction is an asset.
• Excellent attention to detail, sound judgment, and clear communication skills.

What We Offer You:
• Exposure to a wide range of civil engineering disciplines.
• Hands-on experience with real-world engineering projects.
• Access to industry-leading mentors from a multidisciplinary team.
• A workplace culture built on respect and inclusion.
• Continuous support for your professional development and career growth.
• The opportunity to work with an accredited EGBC Member-in-Training partner firm to fast-track your P. Eng.
• Hourly range: $22/h to $32/h. McElhanney offers fair compensation that is commensurate with the individual’s education, experience, skills, and professional qualifications. The posted wage range is representative of the required level of qualifications and experience for the position as noted in the job posting. The salary offered will be based on the experience and qualifications of the successful candidate.

Our Commitment to Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion

At McElhanney, our unwavering commitment lies in cultivating a culture that aligns with our core values and fosters diversity, equity, and inclusion. We celebrate the collective achievements of a team rich in expertise, experiences, and perspectives, and welcome applications from individuals of diverse ethnicities, religions, backgrounds, genders, sexual orientations, gender identities, aboriginal statuses, various age groups, and those with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process. If this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all of the requirements outlined. We’re interested in getting to know you and explore the unique contributions you can bring to McElhanney!

If this is the opportunity for you, apply now o r visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers to learn more. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

To learn more about our recognition as Canada's Top 100 Employers (2024), visit Top Employer: McElhanney Ltd. (canadastop100.com).

Visit us on Glassdoor to learn more about our employee experience.

Our Purpose: Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.

McElhanney is aware of activities where individuals have received fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that McElhanney will not ask applicants for any form of monetary exchange at any point in the recruitment process. To learn more visit: www.mcelhanney.com/careers/fraud-warning . Such transferred personal information may be subject to the laws of these other countries and the laws of other countries regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information may be different from the laws of Canada.

Architectural Intern - ( 240004AL )

Description

As a Canadian, multi-disciplinary architectural and engineering practice, Stantec has proven to be one of the world’s top integrated design firms. Stantec draws on the resources of over 22,000 architects, engineers, designers, field and administrative staff operating from over 400 offices and 6 continents. Since 1954, Stantec has been driven to meet our clients’ needs in ways that reflect our long-term commitment to the people and places we serve. We provide a vast range of award-winning professional services in architecture, engineering, interior design, landscape architecture, energy, sustainability, environmental sciences, project management, and project economics – from inception and planning, through to design, construction, and commissioning. We strive to provide our services in the most holistic and responsible manner, and with a vision to the future.

Stantec Architecture - Manitoba

Our local Buildings Practice reflects our corporate structure, bringing together an integrated, highly motivated, dynamic, and diverse team of Architects, Interior Designers, Landscape Architects, Structural, Mechanical, Energy, Electrical and Sustainability Specialists, and support staff. Working together with our clients as an integrated practice, we believe we are better able to ask the right questions, establish common outcomes, and collectively evaluate and advance meaningful solutions that reflect value, program clarity, and technical astuteness.

As a growing practice, we are driven to achieve Design Excellence through Brilliant Delivery, founded in Communication, Collaboration, Expertise, Research, Technology and Culture.

As an integrated Practice, we also specialize in studios such as Civic [including Culture and Transportation], Commercial [including Retail, Residential, Hospitality, and Mixed-Use], Defense, Healthcare, Industrial, K-12, Post-Secondary, Sport & Recreation, and Workplace. While our office is local, our success and the nature of our broader global practice routinely leads to opportunities to travel and work on projects across North America and beyond.

Your Opportunity

We are looking for an Architectural Intern to fulfill the role of Design and Technical Support. Working closely and under the direct supervision of the project Principal and Project Architect you will be assisting on a wide range of projects with varying levels of complexity and scale and broad integrated design teams working through all project phases from pre-design through post construction services.

Your Key Responsibilities
• Assist with preparing marketing materials including proposals, awards, etc
• Assist with site evaluations including documentation, site and zoning analysis, etc
• Assist with investigating/verifying existing conditions including documentation, measurement, and verification, etc
• Assist with program evaluations
• Participate in client meetings and stakeholder engagement workshops including user group meetings and prepare meeting minutes
• Assist with coordinating project deliverables including schedule, meetings, etc
• Assist with, and/or, develop design options/approach
• Assist with, and/or, develop massing/concept diagrams
• Assist with, and/or, develop block planning and building plans
• Assist with, and/or, develop renderings
• Assist with BIM model set up, and utilizing BIM technologies to design and develop projects
• Participate in design reviews
• Assist with the evaluation and selection of building systems and materials
• Assist with preparing Project/Design Reports including graphic communication, writing, and coordination
• Assist with developing Schematic Design Documents including drawings and outline specifications
• Assist with coordinating building systems
• Assist with implementing sustainable design principles
• Assist with developing Design Development Documents including drawings and outline specifications
• Assist with developing Contract Documents including drawings and coordinating specifications
• Assist with preparing Addenda
• Assist with Supplemental Instructions, Contemplated Change Notices, Change Orders, and Change Directives
• Assist with preparing Record Drawings
• Assist with ensuring the design intent/vision is maintained throughout from conception through system and material selection, visualization, implementation, documentation, coordination, and construction.

Qualifications

Your Capabilities and Credentials
• Excellent verbal, written, and graphic communication skills
• Humble, driven to achieve Design Excellence Delivered Brilliantly, and collaborative with a High EQ
• Ability to engage and work within a creative and critical integrated design practice
• Interest in holistic design, systems thinking, construction, materials, sustainability, and technical design detailing
• Ability to produce design at a level that would be perceived externally as excellent.
• Ability to participate in project team settings.
• Ability to apply accessibility codes, applicable building codes, and life-safety codes to a wide variety of project scopes and complexity.
• General knowledge of building construction systems, constructability, materials, and industry associated standards.
• General understanding of the relationship between drawings and specifications.
• Requires understanding of Microsoft Office, Revit, AutoCAD, Abobe Creative Suite, recent modeling software;

Education and Experience
• Master of Architecture.
• Minimum of 2 years of experience. Internship experience preferred.

This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required of the employee and other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time with or without notice.

Are you an experienced registered nurse, physiotherapist, occupational therapist, social worker, dietitian, or speech language pathologist seeking a rewarding career that cares for others, in a professional practice that cares for you? You’re looking in the right place.

As a Care Coordinator, you will assess and determine patient care needs and eligibility, provide access and referrals to community services, and engage with patients, caregivers and other health care practitioners.

Whether you work in our office, in the community, or a health care facility – you will play a lead role in providing connected, accessible, patient-centred care – and be supported by our collaborative team that includes over 9,000 regulated health care and other professionals.

As a valued team member, your mission will be to help our patients be healthier at home, while you benefit from our supports for professional growth, personal wellness and work-life balance.

What will you do?
• In collaboration with patients and their families, assess care needs, determine eligibility for services, and develop individual care and service plans
• Link patients with service providers
• Coordinate and monitor care plan delivery
• Establish a helping relationship with patients and their families
• Balance patient needs and choices with available resources, ensuring patients’ values and preferences are respected

What must you have?
• Membership, in good standing, with the applicable regulatory body:
• College of Nurses of Ontario
• College of Physiotherapists of Ontario
• College of Occupational Therapists of Ontario
• Ontario College of Social Workers and Social Service Workers
• College of Dietitians of Ontario
• College of Audiologists and Speech Language Pathologists of Ontario
• 2+ years of recent experience in community health or a related field
• Knowledge of the health care delivery system and community resources
• Excellent interpersonal, communication, assessment, problem-solving, and decision-making skills
• Effective time management, prioritization and organizational skills, with the ability to work independently and co-operatively in a busy multidisciplinary environment
• Established ability to accurately complete required documentation, reports and forms
• A valid driver’s licence and access to a reliable vehicle
• Proficient in a Windows environment

If you’re interested in driving excellence in care and service delivery, and seeking an unparalleled opportunity to lead and learn, partner and connect, care and be cared for, this is your home.

Readyportal (A Debut Logic Company) is a leading enterprise content management (ECM) platform offered as both SaaS and Software. Readyportal's suite of content management software also includes social collaboration and portal functionalities that enable corporations, non-profits and small businesses to manage, collaborate and communicate efficiently with their target audience. Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn) to promote our Web Content Management platform. has previous knowledge of, experience, and a keen interest in Social Media Marketing and Communications. has experience with Search Engine Marketing, specifically SEO, Local Search, Adwords, and Paid Search. has a strong understanding of the IT industry and social media platforms, and is aware of emerging technologies which would be a plus point for our company.

can be creative and thinks "outside of the box". Bilingual - English/French (Preferred) The chosen candidate will work between 15-20 hours a week. Candidates must reside in the Greater Toronto Area to be considered for this position.

data.job_description:
Geotechnical Engineering Intern/ Co-op (Spring/Summer 2025) 4-16 Month Term - ( 240004A7 )

Description

Build the foundation for a lasting and successful career in geotechnical engineering by starting with a good team. From field exploration and laboratory testing to the design and construction management of complex geotechnical structures, our team does work that’s rock solid. We perform geotechnical studies to solve pressing infrastructure and construction rehabilitation issues. Sometimes, we break new ground with our ideas. Other times, we’re bringing stability to a project. We push the boundaries as leaders and experts in our field and encourage our fellow team members to do the same. Join our team today!

Your Opportunity

Our Calgary office has an opportunity for a Geotechnical Engineering Intern/ Co-op (4-16 Month Term) starting Spring/Summer 2025. This position will be situated within the Calgary Geotechnical group (25 th Street SE Office).

Your Key Responsibilities
• Provide general support to engineers within the geotechnical group.
• Apply knowledge of the general concepts of relevant civil engineering concepts.
• Perform a variety of tasks which may include geotechnical engineering calculations, field work, contract administration, proposal preparation, obtaining quotes, and preparing basic reports and design criteria for projects.
• Apply technological skills using commonly used software such Microsoft Word, Excel, gINT, GeoStudio, and AutoCAD Civil 3D.
• Perform due diligence and conduct research as required to provide background information to start new projects.
• The responsibilities outlined above are a general guideline; however, other responsibilities may be required to meet project and business demands.

Qualifications

Your Capabilities and Credentials
• Highly motivated, willing to work in a team-oriented environment, and ready to commit to Stantec's strategic initiative to be among the top 10 global design firms.
• Willing to work overtime, weekends, and out of town as required to meet project/business requirements.
• Valid driver’s license.
• Attention to detail and accuracy.
• Excellent communication skills are essential, including interpersonal, written, and verbal abilities to work within a multi-discipline team environment.
• Must be well organized to be able to prioritize multiple tasks and effectively manage time.
• Follow the Health and Safety rules, code of conduct, dress code, and any other Stantec guidelines.
• Complete all tasks assigned by your supervisor.

Education and Experience
• Students who are currently enrolled in their 2 nd , 3 rd or 4 th year in an accredited Canadian Bachelor's in Civil/Geological/Mining Engineering program are encouraged to apply. Prior experience functioning effectively in a team environment is important. Prior relevant work experience is valued but is not required.

This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required of the employee and other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time with or without notice.

Stantec is a place where the best and brightest come to build on each other’s talents, do exciting work, and make an impact on the world around us. Join us and redefine your personal best.

Benefits Summary: Regular full-time and part-time employees will have access to health, dental, and vision plans, a well-being program, health care spending account, wellness spending accounts, group registered retirement savings plan, employee stock purchase program, group tax-free savings account, life and accidental death & dismemberment (AD&D) insurance, short-term/long-term disability plans, emergency travel benefits, tuition reimbursement, professional membership fee coverage, and paid time off.

Temporary/casual employees will have access to group registered retirement savings plan, employee stock purchase program, and group tax-free savings account.

The benefits information listed above may not apply to union positions because benefits for such positions are governed by applicable collective bargaining agreements.

We prohibit discrimination in decisions concerning recruitment, hiring, referral, promotion, compensation, fringe benefits, job training, terminations or any other condition of employment. At CN, we are committed to our pursuit of excellence. We take pride in delivering work of the highest standard, continually innovating to shape the railroad of the future. As responsible railroaders, we make the right decisions every time, putting safety first, acting with unwavering integrity, and holding ourselves accountable for our actions. We believe in succeeding together—by fostering inclusivity and collaboration, we sustainably deliver exceptional results for our customers.

We welcome students aboard to join our team and play a valuable role in the engine that keeps the North American economy on track. Expect an exciting environment where you’ll be encouraged to learn, grow, and be recognized for your unique ideas and contributions. Work on pivotal projects with experienced collaborators who will encourage you to share your perspectives, and thrive in our close-knit, safety-focused culture. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us and get your career moving!

Canadian National Railway Company (CN) is looking for a highly motivated person to fulfill a full-time (40h/week) Intern, Mechanical - Field position in Edmonton, AB from May – August 2025.

Job Summary

The Intern, Mechanical - Field is responsible for collaborating with the Mechanical Field leadership to ensure railcar inspection maintenance and repair is performed safely and efficiently. The incumbent works with different teams such as Mechanical, Transportation, and Reliability to contribute to safety orientation, compliance, enforcement, and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs). The position is involved in leading projects and overseeing project portfolios.

Major Responsibilities
• Support Online Failure Investigation and follow-up
• Assist in response to dangerous good incidents and leaks in yards
• Assist with creation, auditing, and implementation of standard operating procedures
• Contribute to ensuring that Performance Monitoring Reporting Compliance (PMRC) targets, expectations, and objectives are met
• Analyze car inspection and repair productivity using CN’s data
• Perform analysis on locomotive reliability and repair billing initiatives
• Assist in identifying, developing, and initiating improvement activities
• Support in the creation and implementation of locomotive automated alerts
• Assist with development of KPIs on reliability performance
• Help in documenting, identifying, and analyzing failure patterns
• Launch surveys to conduct root cause analysis requirements
• Help with special projects, data analysis and recommendations for improvement, reporting, presentations, and onsite audits of various terminals throughout the region

Requirements
• Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, Teams Notes, and Word)
• Knowledge of reporting software such as Tableau and Smartsheet
• Knowledge of Systems, Applications and Products (SAP), Query Designer, ARIBA or equivalent*
• Knowledge of Service Reliability System (SRS)*
• Valid Driver’s License
• Ability to work outdoors in various types of weather and environmental conditions
• Ability to perform occasional travel (25%) between Canada and the United States (U.S.)

Education
• Working towards a Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical or Industrial Engineering, BCom, Computer Science, or Construction Management
• Any experience/education/skills/knowledge for these above would be considered as an asset

About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

At CN, we are dedicated to building North America’s safest, most inclusive and sustainable railroad, which includes reflecting the communities in which we operate. Research shows that candidates from underrepresented groups often don’t apply unless they feel they fit the job posting at 100%. Even if you don’t see yourself in every job requirement listed in a posting, we still encourage you to apply. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations), please reach out to our team at cnrecruitment@cn.ca.

As an equal employment opportunity employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, and other protected status as required by applicable law. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

data.job_description:
Candidates MUST:
• Live in Canada.
• Be full or part-time students with at least one semester of school remaining in their program.
• Be Canadian citizens, permanent residents, or hold refugee status.
Any candidate that does not have these 3, will not be considered.

Blaise Transit is on a mission to create sustainable, enjoyable, and accessible transportation for all! Our platform allows any organization to create an on-demand transit system using their own vehicles. Unlike traditional (fixed-route) public transit, on-demand transit allows vehicles to be dynamically routed based on passenger demand. Using Blaise, our partner transit agencies can use their vehicles more efficiently (meaning less greenhouse gas emissions), provide a better passenger experience, and connect populations who have never had access to public transit before!

We hold the following values:
• We are sustainable. We leave our clients, our team, and our world better than we found them.
• We are innovative. We experiment with new solutions to help us continually improve.
• We are empathetic. We listen to understand, so we can forge strong relationships.
• We are inclusive. We want to be accessible to everyone, so we seek diverse perspectives.

Things we hope our Frontend Developer Intern will do:
• Implement new features and bug fixes in our mobile and web apps
• Create technical designs for new features, and present them to the team
• Provide feedback on technical designs presented by other developers
• Provide feedback on feature specifications (e.g. user interface mockups and prototypes) created by other members of the Blaise team
• Review code written by other members of our development team

Our Frontend Developer Intern might have:
• Knowledge of frontend development using React.js or React Native
• One or more previous professional experiences (internships) using JavaScript
• A portfolio of projects you worked on by yourself, or in a small team
• Proficiency with Git and ticket management software such as Asana
• BONUS: You’re passionate about code, public transit and urbanism

Perks of joining us:
• Learn how to write production quality code from our team of developers
• Gain experience working as part of a real software development team
• Get feedback and support from a mentor throughout your internship
• Develop your own designs, get feedback, implement them, and see them deployed to production!
• Participate in our Programming Book Club, and pick up best practices, design patterns, and programming concepts that you may not be exposed to during your day-to-day work.
• Work with awesome, driven people!

The Blaise Transit team values diversity in all forms and is an equal opportunity employer. Creating an inclusive environment where everyone feels comfortable is a top priority. To that end, we welcome and encourage applications from those who self-identify as Indigenous, Black, as a Person of Colour, LGBTQ2S+, as a person with a disability, and/or any other minority.

Ready to join one of the fastest-growing, ambitious, impact-driven, and fully remote companies in Montreal?

Blaise Transit a pour mission de créer des solutions de transport durables, agréables et accessibles à tous! Notre plateforme permet à n’importe quelle organisation de créer un système de transport en commun à la demande en utilisant ses propres véhicules. Contrairement au transport en commun traditionnel (c’est-à-dire à itinéraires et horaires fixes), le transport en commun à la demande permet de continuellement réarranger les itinéraires et les horaires des véhicules en fonction de la demande des passagers. Les sociétés de transport faisant appel à notre plateforme peuvent ainsi utiliser leurs véhicules plus efficacement (réduisant ainsi leurs émissions de gaz à effet de serre), offrir une meilleure expérience aux passagers et relier des communautés qui n'ont jamais eu accès à des services de transport en commun auparavant!

Les valeurs fondamentales de Blaise sont les suivantes :
• Nous sommes durables. Nous laissons nos clients, notre équipe et notre monde en meilleur état que nous les avons trouvés.
• Nous sommes innovants. Nous expérimentons continuellement de nouvelles solutions afin de nous améliorer.
• Nous sommes empathiques. Nous écoutons pour comprendre et ainsi développer des relations solides.
• Nous sommes inclusifs. Nous voulons être accessibles à tous et nous recherchons donc des perspectives diverses.

Nous espérons que notre Stagiaire en Développement Frontend pourra assumer les fonctions suivantes:
• Implémenter de nouvelles fonctionnalités et corriger les bogues dans nos applications mobiles et web
• Contribuer à la conception technologique des nouvelles fonctionnalités et la présenter au reste de l’équipe
• Fournir de la rétroaction sur les plans techniques présentés par les autres développeurs
• Fournir de la rétroaction sur les spécifications des fonctionnalités (par exemple des maquettes et prototypes d’interface utilisateur) créées par les autres membres de l’équipe Blaise
• Réviser le code écrit par les autres développeurs

Notre Stagiaire en Développement Frontend aurait idéalement :
• Une bonne connaissance du développement frontend avec les outils React.js ou React Native
• Une ou plusieurs expériences professionnelles antérieures (stages) impliquant JavaScript
• Un portfolio de projets sur lesquels vous avez travaillé seul ou avec une petite équipe
• Une maîtrise de Git et d’un logiciel de gestion de tickets (par exemple Asana)
• BONUS: Une passion pour le transport en commun et l’urbanisme

Les avantages de se joindre à nous :
• Apprendre à écrire du code de production de haute qualité grâce à notre équipe de développeurs
• Acquérir une expérience de travail professionnelle au sein d'une véritable équipe de développement logiciel
• Bénéficier de la rétroaction et du soutien d'un mentor pendant votre stage
• Développer vos propres conceptions, recevoir des conseils sur ceux-ci, les mettre en œuvre et les voir déployées en production!
• Participer à notre club de lecture sur la programmation et développer des meilleures pratiques, des modèles de conception et des concepts de programmation auxquels vous n'êtes peut-être pas exposé dans votre travail quotidien.
• Travailler avec des personnes sympathiques et motivées !

L'équipe de Blaise Transit valorise la diversité sous toutes ses formes et s’engage à garantir l’égalité des chances à toutes les personnes candidates qualifiées. La création d'un environnement inclusif où chacun se sent à l'aise est une priorité absolue. À cette fin, nous accueillons et encourageons les candidatures de tout individu s'identifiant comme autochtone, noir, personne de couleur, LGBTQ2S+, personne handicapée et/ou faisant partie de toute autre minorité.

Êtes-vous prêt à rejoindre une entreprise complètement en télétravail qui est en pleine croissance et parmi les plus ambitieuses et les plus dynamiques de Montréal?

Now hiring! Field Compliance Associate

Contract Duration: 4 - 6 months (Summer)

Saskatoon, SK

We are looking for a Field Compliance Associate to join our AP team in Saskatoon, SK.

Come create chemistry with us!

BASF's Agricultural Solutions division connects innovation, customers, partners and agricultural experts and integrates sustainability criteria into all business decisions. As a Field Compliance Associate, you create chemistry by

If you have

• Problem solving skills and the ability to be flexible and modify plans as situations change.
• The ability to work in a group as well as be self-motivated to get solo tasks accomplished.

• Comfortable being on the road for extended periods of time, driving highway and grid roads to get to post harvest sites.

data.job_title: Volunteer: NGO Management Volunteer Internship (online and in-person) in Peru
data.job_description:
Location: Talara, Peru

Duration: Minimum 2 weeks, maximum 6 months

Start Dates:Project is on-going, and you can join at any time, depending upon availability

Cost for the in-person placement: from $1,466 USD for the first 2 weeks + from $608 for each week thereafter

Cost for the online placement: from $1,081 USD for the first 2 weeks + from $415 for each week thereafter

Benefits:
• Gain personal hands-on experience working with a growing Peruvian NGO.
• Work alongside experienced +amp; passionate professionals and local communities
• Learn from our educational seminars given by our Directors on topics including but not limited to: international development, NGO/social enterprise creation and management, marketing and outreach, research techniques and more.
• IMPACT - your financial contribution helps fund our projects and it also sponsors food for a family in need which has been affected by COVID19. In appreciation the family will, with our help, plant a tree in your name. A thank you photo will be sent to you during your placement.
• Live and work in a north Peru surfing hot-spot (relevant to the in-person placement)

Please note: This opportunity is designed to give you the contacts and experience to help further your career. You are not replacing any member of staff, but helping alongside them, whilst learning new skills. Simply click the APPLY Button to submit your application, and ask as many questions as you need.

Introduction

This project is with a surfing-inspired sustainable development non-profit (NGO) driving the development of poor Peruvian coastal communities through a path of sustainability. We develop environmental, educational, infrastructure and socio-economic projects working hand in hand with local communities and international interns.

We Are Looking For People Passionate About Sustainable Development To Support Us In The Day To Day Management Of The Organisation. The Benefits Of Taking Part In This Volunteer Internship Are:
• Enhance your CV and gain professional hands-on experience managing sustainable projects in an international development NGO, having a real and positive impact on vulnerable communities.
• Work alongside experienced +amp; passionate people from a range of disciplines.
• Learn from our educational seminars given by our Directors on topics including but not limited to: international development, NGO/social enterprise creation and management, marketing and outreach, research techniques and more.
• Live and work in a surfing paradise in northern Peru, the land of endless summer (relevant to the in-person placement).

Daily activities will vary depending on our current projects but volunteer interns will be able to get involved in a variety of tasks and development initiatives including, but not limited to;
• Project Wilipipe - Tide and swell charts for the local fishermen

This project involves creating and distributing tide and swell charts for the local fishermen each week. These charts provide them with vital, scientific data which improves their productivity and economic wellbeing.
• Finances

An important aspect of managing a non-profit organisation is finance. As an NGO management volunteer intern, you will be supporting accounting processes, work with spreadsheets and financial performance metrics and reports.
• Social Media/Website

As a rapidly growing organisation, we are always expanding current projects and creating new ones whilst running community events. Theres a lot going on at EcoSwell every week and we need help documenting it all! You will be supporting by taking photos and making videos of all the ongoing activities as content for our social media platforms and website.
• Project monitoring, data analysis and evaluation

Many of our ongoing projects require monitoring and evaluation of the projects progress for current and future sponsors. NGO management interns can get involved in designing and carrying out surveys in the local community, analysing data and report writing.
• Project maintenance

NGO management volunteer interns are also needed to support other volunteer interns and staff in the maintenance of our reforestation sites, permaculture garden, dry toilet units and more. This gives you a great opportunity to learn about and apply their knowledge and skills in a variety of aspects of sustainable development.

Please note: all information above is subject to change. Please check the most up to date information on the Global Nomadic website when applying. Simply follow the link on the Apply Button above.

Stage Hiver 2025 - Technologie de l'information / 2025 Winter Internship - Information Technology (Mirabel, QC)

Description

!\
• !

Chez Bell nous croyons que le stage doit être une expérience mutuellement enrichissante.

Notre département des technologies de l'information utilise une approche par projets où le stagiaire réalisera chacune des phases du processus de développement. Plusieurs types de projets de développement sont disponibles que ce soient des applications web, des applications clients/serveur, de la migration de base de données, élaboration de services et autres. Afin de rester à l'avant-garde Bell utilise plusieurs des meilleures technologies telles que Visual Studio, ASP.NET Core, DevExpress, OPC UA, SQL Server, etc.

Le stagiaire évoluera au sein du département des technologies de l'information de Bell dans un environnement dynamique et stimulant où le travail d'équipe a une place de choix.

Les responsabilités sont en fonction des connaissances/expériences du stagiaire choisi.

Qualifications

!\

QUALIFICATIONS REQUISES :

+
• Être inscrit dans un programme universitaire en informatiqueLe candidat idéal est motivé, autonome et autodidacte. Le stagiaire prendra place durant son stage sur un ou plusieurs projet(s) utilisant certaines des technologies suivantes : Visual Studio C# .NET, ASP.NET, SQL, Base de données, HTML, JavaScript.
• Être inscrit dans un programme universitaire en informatiqueCapable de travailler dans un environnement multitâche et dans le cadre d'équipes multidisciplinaires.Rapidité d'assimiler de nouvelles connaissances.Forte habileté à résoudre des problématiques.Esprit d'analyses et de synthèses, bonne communication ;Rigoureux, structuré et autonome ;Bilingue parlé et écrit (Anglais et Français).

Ne ratez pas votre chance de vous joindre à un milieu diversifié et inclusif qui favorise un sentiment d'appartenance. En tant que membre de notre effectif mondial, vous collaborerez avec des équipes dévouées et enthousiastes, dont les différences d'expériences, d'antécédents et d'idées et une solide passion pour nos produits nous permettent d'aller au-delà du vol.

Bell Textron Canada Ltée adhère aux principes d'équité en matière d'emploi.

Recruiting Company: Bell Textron Inc.

Primary Location: CA-Quebec-Mirabel

Job Function: Information Technology

Schedule: Full-time

Job Level: Individual Contributor

Job Type: Internship / Co-Op

Shift: First Shift

Job Posting: 09/24/2024, 1:38:41 PM

Job Number: 327814

Introduction

Welcome to Gallagher – a global leader in insurance, risk management, and consulting services. With a growing team of more than 52,000 professionals worldwide, we empower businesses, communities, and individuals to thrive. At Gallagher, you can build a career whether it’s with our brokerage division, our benefits and HR consulting division, or our corporate team. Experience The Gallagher Way, a culture fueled by shared values and a collective passion for excellence. Join one of our dynamic teams, where you'll play a pivotal role in shaping Gallagher's future and unlocking unparalleled opportunities for both clients and yourself.

We believe that every candidate brings something special to the table, including you! So, even if you feel that you’re close but not an exact match, we encourage you to apply.

Overview

Your summer with us

An internship at Gallagher could be the first step on a career path that offers tremendous growth potential. We're a unique organization made better every single day by our dedicated employees and leaders.

Many of our sales professionals started on this program as interns. We're very proud of this fact and believe it speaks volumes about our one-of-a-kind company and culture.

Our comprehensive "learning by doing" experience will provide you with a realistic look at what it means to be a Gallagher Producer through job shadowing, presentations, client project assignments, prospecting, and more.

You'll be given exposure to all divisions and service lines with the opportunity to work in one primary area:
• Insurance under Gallagher Global Brokerage
• Risk management under Risk Placement Services
• Claims under Gallagher Bassett Services

How you'll make an impact

On a day-to-day basis you'll learn and develop skills in five core areas;
• Understanding Consultative Selling - Shadowing our producers, consultants and underwriting teams as they connect with clients and prospects. Doing this will help you gain a better understanding of our sales and marketing process.
• Professional Development - Attending our National Intern Orientation event, weekly training events and case competitions to further develop the qualities you'll need to be a successful sales professional (i.e. communication, emotional intelligence, networking, etc.)
• Collaboration - Growing alongside peers in national and regional sales competitions to invigorate your passion for sales and curiosity about the insurance brokerage world.
• Building Professional Acumen - Learning about our Risk Management, Benefits, Wholesale and Claims businesses. This will help to build a better understanding of clients’ needs and opportunities for growth.
• Culture - You'll experience first-hand the impact our “Gallagher Way” has on how we do business.
• Being a Team Player - Helping with various regional and/or branch projects, showing your passion to learn and be mentored by employees excited to help you navigate your future.

About you
• We're looking for people who are excited to explore a career in sales and client relations that is both rewarding personally, and professionally.
• With a self-starter attitude, you'll be collaborative and have the enthusiasm to understand people's needs.
• You'll be able to manage relationships, provide leadership where needed, and demonstrate your interpersonal skills when working well with others.
• You'll be able to organize yourself and your work, have the ability to multi-task and have a passion to build a supportive network.
• If you have all that, we know you'll thrive within our growing entrepreneurial Fortune 500 organization!
• Rising 3rd and 4th years with an expected graduation date between December 2025 and June 2027
• Availability to participate within program dates: May 12th, 2025 to August 15th, 2025

Compensation and benefits

On top of a competitive salary, great teams and exciting career opportunities, we also offer a wide range of benefits.

Below are the minimum core benefits you’ll get, depending on your job level these benefits may improve:
• Flexible medical & dental coverage to meet your household's needs
• Life, Dependent Life and AD & D Insurance options
• Retirement savings including RRSP including a company match, TFSA, pension and more
• Employee Stock Purchase Plan

Other benefits include:
• Educational expense reimbursement
• Employee assistance programs
• Discounted gym membership (GoodLife Fitness)
• Opportunity for flexible work arrangements
• Paid sick days & personal days
• Paid Time Off to Volunteer
• Employee education recognition program
• Employee referral bonus program
• LifeWorks Employee Assistance Program
• Matching Gift Program
• We value inclusion and diversity

Inclusion and diversity (I&D) is a core part of our business, and it’s embedded into the fabric of our organization. For more than 95 years, Gallagher has led with a commitment to sustainability and to support the communities where we live and work.

Gallagher embraces our employees’ diverse identities, experiences and talents, allowing us to better serve our clients and communities. We see inclusion as a conscious commitment and diversity as a vital strength. By embracing diversity in all its forms, we live out The Gallagher Way to its fullest.

We are an equal opportunity employer which values diversity in the workplace and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Gallagher believes that all persons are entitled to equal employment opportunity and prohibits any form of discrimination by its managers, employees, vendors or customers based on race, color, religion, creed, gender (including pregnancy status), sexual orientation, gender identity (which includes transgender and other gender non-conforming individuals), gender expression, hair expression, marital status, parental status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, medical condition, genetic information, veteran or military status, citizenship status, or any other characteristic protected (herein referred to as “protected characteristics”) by applicable federal, state, or local laws.

Equal employment opportunity will be extended in all aspects of the employer-employee relationship, including, but not limited to, recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, transfer, demotion, compensation, benefits, layoff, and termination. In addition, Gallagher will make reasonable accommodations to known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified person with a disability, unless the accommodation would impose an undue hardship on the operation of our business.

Résumé des fonctions...

Le pharmacien stagiaire tente d’obtenir son permis de pharmacien en suivant les conseils de son pharmacien précepteur.

Ce que vous ferez...

Gérer, soutenir et représenter les valeurs de base de l’entreprise du respect de la personne, offrir un service à la clientèle et viser l’excellence. Responsable de remplir toutes les exigences d’un stagiaire décrites par son organisme de réglementation provincial afin d’obtenir son permis de pharmacien en temps opportun. Sous la supervision de son précepteur, utiliser ses connaissances et ses compétences uniques afin de répondre aux besoins liés aux médicaments du patient, offrir des soins centrés sur le patient en partenariat avec les patients et les professionnels de la santé afin d’atteindre des résultats positifs concernant la santé ou maintenir ou améliorer la qualité de vie du patient. Sous la supervision de son précepteur, pratiquer conformément aux exigences juridiques et aux principes éthiques, démontrer de l’intégrité et faire preuve de professionnalisme, agir afin de respecter des normes professionnelles de pratique. En collaboration avec le gérant de la pharmacie désigné et son précepteur, le stagiaire adhère aux attentes et aux mesures opérationnelles de la Compagnie.

data.job_title: Field Services Co-op Student - Community Development (Summer 2025) - 8 Months
data.job_description:
Field Services Co-op Student - Community Development (Summer 2025) - 8 Months - ( 240004AT )

Description

Stantec’s Alberta based Community Development group is a market leader in the real estate planning and development industry. Our experts lead their fields, collaborating on projects that are as technically challenging as they are impactful, creative, and fulfilling. We’re a place where you can apply your passion—and find endless opportunities to help make communities more equitable, resilient, and livable.

Our multidisciplinary team covers planning and urban design, civil and stormwater engineering, landscape architecture, private site development, and construction management. We work with a diverse group of clients in land and site development, city-building and municipal projects, public realm and open space, and planning and development policy and strategy. Successful delivery of a diverse portfolio of projects and clients begins with insight and foresight into industry trends and engagement.

Your Opportunity

We have an opportunity for a Field Services Co-op Student (8 Month Term) to join our Calgary Community Development group. This is a fantastic opportunity to gain exposure to a strong and collaborative team of industry leading professionals. We take pride in providing opportunity for professional growth and offer a unique constructive environment where you are able to see the efforts of your work take tangible shape in the roadways that we drive on, the parks that we play in, and the structures that we call home.

As a Coop Student, you will be working on Residential, Commercial, and Institutional infrastructure projects on our Field Services Team, as part of our Community Development Business Centre. The primary responsibilities for this role are varied; however generally involve the observation, recording and reporting of construction activities for compliance with standard specifications and design intent in Calgary and in surrounding communities.

Your Key Responsibilities

As the successful candidate you will be working within project teams and will be responsible for, but not limited to the following:
• Review and interpretation of approved engineering drawings.
• Review and cross reference of construction grade sheets for issuance to contractors.
• Observation of infrastructure installation for compliance with specification.
• Daily on-site construction coordination, including liaison with contractors, City of Calgary / other Municipalities staff, geotechnical consultants and construction surveyors, as well as other specialized consultants.
• Recording of all daily activity on construction projects, including material used, daily labour, equipment and site progress.
• Review, coordination and implementation of erosion and sediment controls on active work sites.
• Preparation of cost analysis and recommendations of costs for senior staff consideration with respect to erosion and sediment control projects.
• Meet, review and report to the project team on construction status, issues and concerns.
• Actively participate in the implementation of safety controls and promotion of safety in the workplace.
• Candidates must be prepared to work extended hours and weekends.

Qualifications

Your Capabilities and Credentials
• Very attentive to details and well organized.
• Ability to work with others on large projects and committed to teamwork, in a very fast paced and dynamic work environment.
• Ability to solve problems using sound professional judgment, creativity, and innovation.
• Effective written and verbal communication skills.
• The ability to lift and move items and equipment up to 50 lbs is a requirement for this position

Education and Experience
• Enrolled in a civil engineering technologist, municipal design or project management / construction project management program or registered in an engineering undergraduate program, preferably with a Civil Engineering major, in 1st, 2nd or 3rd year of their program.
• A valid driver’s license (upgraded to full class 5 driver’s license, no GDL).

Typical office environment working with computers and remaining sedentary for long periods of time. Field work may include long days (12 hours), with last minute schedule changes and exposure to the elements including inclement weather.

This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required of the employee and other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time with or without notice.

Stantec is a place where the best and brightest come to build on each other’s talents, do exciting work, and make an impact on the world around us. Join us and redefine your personal best.

Benefits Summary: Regular full-time and part-time employees will have access to health, dental, and vision plans, a well-being program, health care spending account, wellness spending accounts, group registered retirement savings plan, employee stock purchase program, group tax-free savings account, life and accidental death & dismemberment (AD&D) insurance, short-term/long-term disability plans, emergency travel benefits, tuition reimbursement, professional membership fee coverage, and paid time off.

Temporary/casual employees will have access to group registered retirement savings plan, employee stock purchase program, and group tax-free savings account.

The benefits information listed above may not apply to union positions because benefits for such positions are governed by applicable collective bargaining agreements.

Modern Sales Co-op

Co-op student opportunity - Accounting Associate

Winter 2025 Work Term

Are you looking for a great career opportunity for your co-op placement this Winter? Are you a quick learner who is ready to gain practical skills? We are looking for talented and enthusiastic individuals to join the Modern Sales Co-op FINANCE team! Our co-op placement offers a crash course in business operations, gained through hands-on experience working with our members, vendors and other business partners.

Over the course of your four-month co-op placement, you will:
• Work with great people: Work directly with teams across all departments including Product, Pricing, Inventory Control, Sales & Marketing and Member Services in a fun, team-oriented and learning environment where every person's contributions are valued.
• Apply your learnings: Improve our member experience by working with your fellow interns and other team members on critical business projects. Work projects are carefully selected to allow interns the opportunity to learn about business operations, jump in with enthusiasm, and bring their ideas forward to make tangible impacts.
• Discover opportunity: See how all departments interact with each other to support business operations and explore the many different career paths available at Modern Sales.
• Diversity, Equity and Inclusion. We are a culture that celebrates each other's differences, continuously strives for equality and recognizes that inclusion makes us stronger as individuals, a company and a corporate citizen.
• Develop your communication, project management, and analytical skills with training and hands-on opportunities to apply your learnings.
• Modern Sales Co-op is one of Canada's most diverse co-operative organizations linking over 400 suppliers of automotive and other products with several hundred member locations across Canada.
• Assist with managing a list of assigned vendor accounts, processing of invoices and checking statements for assigned accounts and contact vendors, as necessary.

During your work term with us, you will:
• Interact with peers and receive mentorship from tenured professionals and knowledge experts in the automotive after-market industry.
• Learn how to source and use data to produce and present reports to the senior Leadership Team.
• Gain the opportunity to secure future co-operative positions in subsequent work terms and the potential to lead to a full-time permanent position within our organization.

Who we are:
• Operating for nearly 90 years, Modern Sales Co-op has grown to become a leading national distribution organization with a vast membership network coast to coast in Canada.
• Our distribution centers are established in British Columbia, Manitoba, and Alberta, all supported by our head office and main distribution center located in Barrie, Ontario.
• With over 130 employees, our team strives to continue to provide optimum service to meet the needs of our growing membership.

What you will do:
• Assist with the preparation of accounting reports, and year-end processes by gathering documents required by auditors.
• Assist with other general finance and administrative support such as preparing reports, filing documentation, sorting and distributing of incoming mail and faxes to all departments, general housekeeping duties of the reception area and mailroom, maintaining the schedule and use of the company meeting rooms, ordering and maintaining supplies of cleaning products and essential warehouse items, as well as providing support on reception, including greeting members, suppliers, visitors, and employees to ensure optimum customer service.
• You are enrolled in the Automotive Business Program, Business Accounting or Business Administration program or other business program in marketing, research analyst, business technology management, math/statistics, or economics.
• You are enrolled in a college program and are required to complete a co-op work experience.

What you will need:
• You are willing to work in-person at the Barrie office location 5 days per week. We value in-person collaboration and believe working in-office is the best way to establish meaningful relationships, interact with our team and provide you with the best co-operative work experience.
• You have excellent interpersonal and communication skills, including exemplary phone/email etiquette skills.
• You have excellent time management and organization skills.
• You have strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills.
• You have demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office applications including Outlook, with special focus on Excel and Word.
• You have introductory experience, or the desire to learn, data tools and software.
• You have a positive and respectful attitude.
• You have the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment and work in a collaborative manner with cross functional teams.
• You are self-reliant, independent; you are stable, adaptive, and able to handle a stressful situation with calm and reason.
• French language is an asset but not required.

While we thank all candidates in advance for their application, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Modern Sales Co-op is committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible workplace where every team member feels valued, respected, and supported, and has the opportunity to reach their full potential. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available at all stages of the recruitment process at the candidate's request.

data.job_title: Stagiaire M/A /t/ 2025/ / Mergers and Acquisitions Intern /Summer 2025/
data.job_description:
L'anglais suivra ci-dessous / English to follow below

Êtes-vous un étudiant universitaire ou un jeune diplômé passionné par la finance et intéressé par les fusions et acquisitions (M&A) à la recherche d'un stage d'été? Si c'est le cas, nous avons une opportunité passionnante à vous proposer ! Rejoignez notre équipe en tant que stagiaire en fusions et acquisitions et acquérez une expérience pratique précieuse dans le monde des fusions et acquisitions.

Chez Valsoft, notre mission est d'acquérir et de développer des entreprises de logiciels verticaux fournissant des solutions essentielles à leurs marchés de niche. Depuis notre fondation en 2015, nous avons acquis plus de 90 entreprises, et notre famille mondiale compte désormais plus de 3,000 employés répartis dans plus de 14 pays. Notre modèle unique favorise un environnement de croissance rapide, vous offrant des opportunités exceptionnelles pour façonner votre carrière.

Responsabilités principales :
• Effectuer des recherches sur le secteur afin de soutenir les activités de développement commercial.
• Identifier et qualifier les prospects qui correspondent à notre profil d'investissement.
• Identifier des organismes de recherche, des groupes consultatifs et des conférences commerciales pertinents.
• Assister l'équipe d'investissement dans des tâches et des projets analytiques, y compris l'évaluation, la diligence raisonnable, etc.
• Exécuter d'autres tâches connexes selon les besoins.

Notre candidat idéal :
• Actuellement inscrit à un programme de baccalauréat ou de maîtrise ou récemment diplômé en finance, en affaires, en économie ou dans un domaine connexe.
• Solides compétences en matière d'analyse et de résolution de problèmes.
• Excellentes aptitudes à la communication et aux relations interpersonnelles.
• Maîtrise de Microsoft Excel et modélisation financière.
• une volonté d'apprendre et de s'adapter à un environnement dynamique et en constante évolution.

Pourquoi nous choisir :
• Une expérience pratique dans le domaine dynamique des fusions et acquisitions au sein d'une entreprise qui a réalisé 25 transactions en 2023.
• Mentorat et encadrement par des professionnels expérimentés.
• Possibilités de réseautage avec des professionnels du secteur.
• Possibilités de croissance et d'évolution de carrière.
• Faire partie d'une culture entrepreneuriale, où vos idées novatrices et vos nouvelles perspectives sont appréciées et peuvent avoir un impact réel sur nos activités.

Prêt à avoir un impact immédiat ? Rejoignez notre équipe collaborative et innovante chez Valsoft !

_____________________________________________________________________________________

Are you a university student or recent graduate with a passion for finance and a keen interest in Mergers and Acquisitions (M&A) looking for a summer internship? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you! Join our team as an M&A Intern and gain valuable hands-on experience in the world of mergers and acquisitions.

At Valsoft, our mission is to acquire and nurture vertical software businesses that deliver mission-critical solutions in their niche markets. Since our founding in 2015, we've acquired over 90 businesses across 25+ industries, and our global family now comprises more than 3,000 employees across 14+ countries. Our unique model fosters an environment of rapid growth, providing you with unparalleled opportunities to shape your career.

Core Duties:
• Conduct industry research to support business development activities.
• Identify and qualify prospects that fit our investment profile.
• Identify relevant research organizations, advisory groups, and trade conferences.
• Assist the investment team on analytical tasks and projects, including valuation, due diligence, and more.
• Perform other related duties as assigned.

Our Ideal Hire:
• Currently enrolled in a bachelor's or master's degree program or a recent graduate in Finance, Business, Economics, or a related field.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
• Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and financial modeling.
• An eagerness to learn and adapt in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.

Why Choose Us:
• Hands-on experience in the dynamic field of mergers and acquisitions in a company that has closed 25 deals in 2023.
• Mentorship and guidance from experienced professionals.
• Networking opportunities with professionals in the field.
• Opportunities for growth and career development.
• Be a part of an entrepreneurial culture, where your innovative ideas and fresh perspectives are valued and can make a real impact on our business.

Join us in shaping the future of M&A and embark on a journey of professional growth and success. We look forward to welcoming the next generation of M&A professionals to our team!

If you have a passion for the financial technology industry and are skilled at finance management, consider applying to Wealthsimple Careers. This company is an industry leader in accessible finance services while utilizing advanced technology to benefit consumers. They generally offer roles for client service representatives, software developers, and more. In addition to this, they also offer internship programs for young graduates to provide practical skills. Moreover, interested candidates can also work remotely if willing to work on flexible schedules.

There is currently a wide range of Wealthsimple Jobs available for those residing in Toronto, Mississauga, and across Canada. The company offers a range of positions suitable for those interested in personal finance and wealth management. With roles ranging from technical support to portfolio management, the corporation focuses on providing a supportive environment where individual talents are developed. Here, teamwork is emphasized to develop and improve services while ensuring that every employee has the opportunity to contribute to the organization’s mission. So why wait? Apply today and join this incredible team.

Wealthsimple Careers in Toronto & Across Canada 2024

Wealthsimple Overview

Wealthsimple is a Canadian financial services provider known for its logical approach to investing and managing resources. Established in 2014, it quickly became Canada’s largest automated advisor with billions of dollars in assets. With a majority share owned by Power Corporation, it holds an indirect 54.2% stake through investments managed by Power Financial, IGM, and Portag3. The strategy shows its approach across a variety of economic sectors.

In Canada, Wealthsimple has established itself by focusing on customer satisfaction and offering exceptional financial solutions. It provides services like Wealthsimple Trade, which allows commission-free stock and ETF trading, and Wealthsimple Crypto, which is designed to address the growing interest in cryptocurrencies. Its personalized approach features no account minimums and a user-friendly interface. This ensures that residents of the country can manage their finances with confidence and ease while contributing significantly to the overall economy.

Why Do Professionals Prefer Working in Wealthsimple?

Wealthsimple Careers has a strong reputation in Canada for its commitment to providing a welcoming work environment.The company is recognized for its commitment to providing simplified and meaningful financial services. This offers employees the chance to directly contribute to simplifying budgeting for everyone. The workplace here encourages personal and professional growth while making it a preferred destination for industry talents looking for rewarding work in this sector.

Perks & Benefits:

Competitive salaries and comprehensive perks are just some of the reasons why employees are attracted to Wealthsimple Jobs. This approach emphasizes the company’s commitment to creating a supportive environment where every team member feels valued and motivated. The following are the benefits they usually offer:
• Exceptional Pay
• Flexible Working Hours
• Health and Dental Insurance
• Retirement Savings Plan
• Stock Options
• Paid Parental Leave
• Personal Wellness Fund
• Professional Development
• Employee Assistance Program

Basic Criteria & Requirements:

Wealthsimple looks for candidates who connect positively with its values of simplicity and accountability. Applicants are expected to have an excellent foundation in their respective fields and a passion for financial technology. The following are the qualifications and requirements for employment here:
• Relevant educational background is required
• An understanding of fintech or a related field is necessary
• Ability to analyze and solve problems with a strong analytical mindset
• The ability to communicate effectively should be excellent
• An ethical commitment to the financial industry
• Having the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
• Expertise in the use of digital software and platforms.

Often Available Positions:

Wealthsimple frequently recruits for a variety of roles across multiple fields. The corporation frequently hires for technology and customer support roles, alongside specialized positions in finance and compliance. These opportunities are designed for individuals who are skilled at balancing technical expertise with exceptional interpersonal skills. Here’s a list of jobs often offered:
• Software Engineer
• Data Scientist
• Product Manager
• Compliance Officer
• Customer Success Representative
• Operations Analyst
• Marketing Specialist
• Human Resources Coordinator
• Risk Analyst

How to Apply for Wealthsimple Jobs?

The procedure to apply for Wealthsimple Careers is designed to be convenient and accessible. To begin, simply visit the official recruitment portal. Here, candidates can access a variety of roles and apply with ease. Follow the steps below to apply:
• Hit the “Apply Here” button to go to the official hiring webpage.
• Browse available job listings.
• Select the position that fits your qualifications.
• Read the job description thoroughly.
• Click on the “Apply Now” button if you meet the role requirements.
• Create an account or log in to your existing account.
• Prepare and upload your resume and cover letter.
• Fill out the application form with your details.
• Submit your application and await confirmation.
